query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 La bocca sollevò dal fiero pasto 2 quel peccator, forbendola a’ capelli 3 del capo ch’elli avea di retro guasto.
query.result: 1 The mouth lifted from the fierce feast 2 that sinner, bending it to the hairs 3 of the head that he had damaged in the rear.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 Poi cominciò: «Tu vuo’ ch’io rinovelli 5 disperato dolor che ’l cor mi preme 6 già pur pensando, pria ch’io ne favelli.
query.result: 4 Then he began: “You want that I renew 5 desperate pain that the heart presses on me 6 already just thinking, before I speak of it.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Ma se le mie parole esser dien seme 8 che frutti infamia al traditor ch’i’ rodo, 9 parlar e lagrimar vedrai insieme.
query.result: 7 But if my words are a seed for you 8 that bears infamy to the traitor whom I gnaw, 9 you will see speaking and weeping together.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Io non so chi tu se’ né per che modo 11 venuto se’ qua giù; ma fiorentino 12 mi sembri veramente quand’ io t’odo.
query.result: 10 I do not know who you are nor by what way 11 you have come down here; but Florentine 12 I truly seem to you when I hear you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Tu dei saper ch’i’ fui conte Ugolino, 14 e questi è l’arcivescovo Ruggieri: 15 or ti dirò perché i son tal vicino.
query.result: 13 You ought to know that I was Count Ugolino, 14 and this is Archbishop Ruggieri: 15 now I will tell you why we are so close.

16 That by the effect of his ever-thoughts, 17 trusting in him, I was taken 18 and afterward killed, it is not necessary to tell;
19 however, what you cannot have understood, 20 that is, how my death was cruel, 21 you will hear, and you will know if it has offended me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Breve pertugio dentro da la Muda, 23 la qual per me ha ’l titol de la fame, 24 e che conviene ancor ch’altrui si chiuda,
25 m’avea mostrato per lo suo forame 26 più lune già, quand’ io feci ’l mal sonno 27 che del futuro mi squarciò ’l velame.
query.result:
22 A brief opening inside from the Muda, 23 which through me has the title of hunger, 24 and that it is also necessary that another be closed,
25 had shown to me through its hole 26 already many moons, when I made the bad dream 27 that tore the veil from my future.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Questi pareva a me maestro e donno, 29 cacciando il lupo e ’ lupicini al monte 30 per che i Pisan veder Lucca non ponno.
query.result: 28 This one seemed to me master and lord, 29 chasing the wolf and the wolf-cubs to the mountain 30 so that the Pisans cannot see Lucca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Con cagne magre, studïose e conte 32 Gualandi con Sismondi e con Lanfranchi 33 s’avea messi dinanzi da la fronte.
query.result: 31 With lean hounds, studious and Count 32 Gualandi with Sismondi and with Lanfranchi 33 he had placed before his forehead.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 In picciol corso mi parieno stanchi 35 lo padre e ’ figli, e con l’agute scane 36 mi parea lor veder fender li fianchi.
query.result: 34 In small course they seemed tired to me 35 the father and the sons, and with the sharp skins 36 it seemed to me to see them tear the flanks.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Quando fui desto innanzi la dimane, 38 pianger senti’ fra ’l sonno i miei figliuoli 39 ch’eran con meco, e dimandar del pane.
query.result: 37 When I awoke before the dawn, 38 I heard weeping in sleep my children 39 who were with me, and asking for bread.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Ben se’ crudel, se tu già non ti duoli 41 pensando ciò che ’l mio cor s’annunziava; 42 e se non piangi, di che pianger suoli?
43 Già eran desti, e l’ora s’appressava 44 che ’l cibo ne solëa essere addotto, 45 e per suo sogno ciascun dubitava;
46 e io senti’ chiavar l’uscio di sotto 47 a l’orribile torre; ond’ io guardai 48 nel viso a’ mie’ figliuoi sanza far motto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Io non piangëa, sì dentro impetrai: 50 piangevan elli; e Anselmuccio mio 51 disse: “Tu guardi sì, padre! che hai?”.
query.result: 49 I did not weep, so within I became stone: 50 they wept; and Anselmuccio mine 51 said: “You look so, father! what do you have?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Perciò non lagrimai né rispuos’ io 53 tutto quel giorno né la notte appresso, 54 infin che l’altro sol nel mondo uscìo.
query.result: 52 Therefore I did not weep nor did I answer 53 all that day nor the following night, 54 until the other sun came out into the world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Come un poco di raggio si fu messo 56 nel doloroso carcere, e io scorsi 57 per quattro visi il mio aspetto stesso,
58 ambo le man per lo dolor mi morsi; 59 ed ei, pensando ch’io ’l fessi per voglia 60 di manicar, di sùbito levorsi
61 e disser: “Padre, assai ci fia men doglia 62 se tu mangi di noi: tu ne vestisti 63 queste misere carni, e tu le spoglia”.
query.result:
55 As a little ray was placed 56 in the sorrowful prison, and I saw 57 through four faces my own appearance,
58 both hands I bit through the pain; 59 and he, thinking that I did it with desire 60 to eat, immediately rose
61 and said: “Father, there will be less pain for us 62 if you eat of us: you clothed 63 these miserable bodies, and you strip them”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Queta’mi allor per non farli più tristi; 65 lo dì e l’altro stemmo tutti muti; 66 ahi dura terra, perché non t’apristi?
67 Poscia che fummo al quarto dì venuti, 68 Gaddo mi si gittò disteso a’ piedi, 69 dicendo: “Padre mio, ché non m’aiuti?”.

Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Quivi morì; e come tu mi vedi, 71 vid’ io cascar li tre ad uno ad uno 72 tra ’l quinto dì e ’l sesto; ond’ io mi diedi,
73 già cieco, a brancolar sovra ciascuno, 74 e due dì li chiamai, poi che fur morti.
query.result:
70 There he died; and as you see me, 71 I saw fall the three, one by one 72 between the fifth day and the sixth; whence I gave myself,
73 already blind, to grope over each one, 74 and for two days I called them, after they were dead.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
75 Poscia, più che ’l dolor, poté ’l digiuno».
76 Quand’ ebbe detto ciò, con li occhi torti 77 riprese ’l teschio misero co’ denti, 78 che furo a l’osso, come d’un can, forti.
query.result:
75 Afterwards, more than the pain, the fasting could [overcome me].
76 When he had said this, with twisted eyes 77 he resumed the miserable skull with teeth, 78 which were to the bone, like those of a dog, strong.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Ahi Pisa, vituperio de le genti 80 del bel paese là dove ’l sì suona, 81 poi che i vicini a te punir son lenti,
82 muovasi la Capraia e la Gorgona, 83 e faccian siepe ad Arno in su la foce, 84 sì ch’elli annieghi in te ogne persona!
85 Che se ’l conte Ugolino aveva voce 86 d’aver tradita te de le castella, 87 non dovei tu i figliuoi porre a tal croce.
query.result:
79 Ah, Pisa, disgrace of the people 80 of the beautiful country where the “si” sounds, 81 since your neighbors are slow to punish you,
82 Capraia and Gorgona move, 83 and make a hedge to the Arno at its mouth, 84 so that they may drown in you every person!
85 For if Count Ugolino had the voice 86 of having betrayed you of the castles, 87 you should not have placed his children on such a cross.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Innocenti facea l’età novella, 89 novella Tebe, Uguiccione e ’l Brigata 90 e li altri due che ’l canto suso appella.
query.result: 88 The new age made innocents, 89 new Thebes, Uguiccione and the Company 90 and the other two that the above song calls.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Noi passammo oltre, là ’ve la gelata 92 ruvidamente un’altra gente fascia, 93 non volta in giù, ma tutta riversata.
query.result: 91 We passed beyond, there where the frozen 92 roughly bands another people, 93 not turned downwards, but all overturned.

94 The same weeping there does not allow weeping, 95 and the pain that finds itself on the eyes, blocked, 96 turns inward to make the numbness grow;
97 because the first tears make a clump, 98 and as visors of crystal, 99 they fill under the eyelid all the space.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E avvegna che, sì come d’un callo, 101 per la freddura ciascun sentimento 102 cessato avesse del mio viso stallo,
103 già mi parea sentire alquanto vento; 104 per ch’io: «Maestro mio, questo chi move? 105 non è qua giù ogne vapore spento?».
query.result:
100 And although that, as from a callus, 101 because of the cold each feeling 102 had ceased from the place of my face,
103 already it seemed to me to feel somewhat wind; 104 for which I: “My master, who moves this? 105 is not all vapor extinguished down here?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Ond’ elli a me: «Avaccio sarai dove 107 di ciò ti farà l’occhio la risposta, 108 veggendo la cagion che ’l fiato piove».
query.result: 106 And he to me: “Soon you will be where 107 of this your eye will give the answer, 108 seeing the cause that the breath rains down.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 E un de’ tristi de la fredda crosta 110 gridò a noi: «O anime crudeli 111 tanto che data v’è l’ultima posta,
112 levatemi dal viso i duri veli, 113 sì ch’ïo sfoghi ’l duol che ’l cor m’impregna, 114 un poco, pria che ’l pianto si raggeli».
query.result:
109 And one of the sad ones from the cold crust 110 cried to us: “O cruel souls, 111 so much that the last post is given to you,
112 lift from my face the hard veils, 113 so that I may release the pain that impregnates my heart, 114 a little, before the weeping freezes over.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Per ch’io a lui: «Se vuo’ ch’i’ ti sovvegna, 116 dimmi chi se’, e s’io non ti disbrigo, 117 al fondo de la ghiaccia ir mi convegna».
query.result: 115 For which I to him: “If you want that I help you, 116 tell me who you are, and if I do not unburden you, 117 to the bottom of the ice it will be necessary for me to go.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Rispuose adunque: «I’ son frate Alberigo; 119 i’ son quel da le frutta del mal orto, 120 che qui riprendo dattero per figo».

Please translate each line literally into English.
121 «Oh», diss’ io lui, «or se’ tu ancor morto?». 122 Ed elli a me: «Come ’l mio corpo stea 123 nel mondo sù, nulla scïenza porto.
query.result: 121 “Oh,” I said to him, “are you still dead?” 122 And he to me: “How my body stands 123 in the world above, I bring no knowledge.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Cotal vantaggio ha questa Tolomea, 125 che spesse volte l’anima ci cade 126 innanzi ch’Atropòs mossa le dea.
query.result: 124 Such advantage has this Tolomea, 125 that often the soul falls here 126 before Atropos moves the fates.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 E perché tu più volentier mi rade 128 le ’nvetrïate lagrime dal volto, 129 sappie che, tosto che l’anima trade
130 come fec’ ïo, il corpo suo l’è tolto 131 da un demonio, che poscia il governa 132 mentre che ’l tempo suo tutto sia vòlto.
query.result:
127 And because you more willingly wipe away 128 the icy tears from my face, 129 know that, as soon as the soul departs
130 as I did, its body is taken 131 by a demon, who then governs it 132 while its time is all turned.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Ella ruina in sì fatta cisterna; 134 e forse pare ancor lo corpo suso 135 de l’ombra che di qua dietro mi verna.

Please translate each line literally into English.
136 Tu ’l dei saper, se tu vien pur mo giuso: 137 elli è ser Branca Doria, e son più anni 138 poscia passati ch’el fu sì racchiuso».
query.result: 136 You should know it, if you come down here now: 137 he is Ser Branca Doria, and more years 138 have passed since he was thus enclosed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 «Io credo», diss’ io lui, «che tu m’inganni; 140 ché Branca Doria non morì unquanche, 141 e mangia e bee e dorme e veste panni».

Please translate each line literally into English.
142 «Nel fosso sù», diss’ el, «de’ Malebranche, 143 là dove bolle la tenace pece, 144 non era ancora giunto Michel Zanche,
145 che questi lasciò il diavolo in sua vece 146 nel corpo suo, ed un suo prossimano 147 che ’l tradimento insieme con lui fece.
query.result:
142 “Up into the ditch,” he said, “of the Malebranche, 143 where boils the tenacious pitch, 144 had not yet arrived Michel Zanche,
145 who these left the devil in his place 146 in his body, and a his close companion 147 who the betrayal together with him did.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
151 Ahi Genovesi, uomini diversi 152 d’ogne costume e pien d’ogne magagna, 153 perché non siete voi del mondo spersi?
154 Ché col peggiore spirto di Romagna 155 trovai di voi un tal, che per sua opra 156 in anima in Cocito già si bagna,
157 e in corpo par vivo ancor di sopra.
query.result:
151 Ah Genoese, men different 152 from every custom and full of every corruption, 153 why are you not lost from the world?
154 For with the worst spirit of Romagna 155 I found one of you, who through his work 156 already bathes in Cocitus in soul,
157 and in body still seems alive above.
